definition: funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay

sentences.english: He had arrived in London with nothing but his air force pay.
sentences.chinese: 他到達倫敦時身邊只有空軍的軍餉。

sentences.english: The government's own troops are ill-equipped and rarely paid.
sentences.chinese: 政府軍裝備不良，軍餉都很少發。

sentences.english: Many times the army had no food and no pay.
sentences.chinese: 有好多次軍隊一無糧食二無軍餉。

sentences.english: "Wages" was often used for soldier's pay, that which was owed to the man.
sentences.chinese: 通常是指士兵的軍餉，是他應得的工資。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
